description:
Join the Patreon Gear Giveaway and Support the Channel Here:
https://www.patreon.com/bcbushcraft

Survival. Everyone has watched those shows on TV and have thought about what it would be like to survive in the woods. I like to take it one step further and decided to embark on a solo survival adventure. Alone on Vancouver Island, I test my survival skills built upon a knowledge base of bushcraft and camping. Bringing only a large knife and a ferro rod, as well as camera gear and a backpack, I set out to see what I can do alone in the wild.
Enjoy,
Dave from BC Bushcraft


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Episode 2 of my Bushcraft Camp Build. This episode is all about building the frame of the Super Shelter. I plan on using as much natural materials as possible for this bushcraft shelter. I won't be using a tarp to cover the bushcraft camp so the frame is designed to hold weight and materials that will be used for the roof. Really hope you enjoy this one and the rest of the series, I am loving the process of the bushcraft basecamp build. I can't wait to have a great bushcraft camp to hang out at for later adventures and bushcraft and survival videos.

Cheers Dave

Doing another solo overnight but instead of a solo survival video I wanted some camp life and did more of a solo overnight bushcraft camp. In this bushcraft overnight trip I built a raised bed, a nice fire reflector, and established a really nice camp. It rained on and off but fire was no problem. It felt really nice to relax this trip, and was a huge difference to my survival video. Practicing some bushcraft skills was fun, and relaxing by the fire was very enjoyable too. While I shot this video, I happened to see a deer being chased through the woods by what I believe to be a dog. I also came across three deer bones, one of them had a full set of antlers. So I'm not sure what to say about that, or whether it was the dog I saw or cougars in the area. Regardless, I had an awesome time out there on this solo overnight bushcraft camp. Cheers Dave

A short video showing that you can eat new growth in spring time of most evergreen trees. The tree that I picked the young needles from was a douglas fir tree. These new young shoots are high in vitamin C and other minerals, providing an energy boost and quite a nice tasting snack. You could even collect a few for a wild edible spring time salad. Hope you enjoy, please like and subscribe.
Dave from BC Bushcraft

[My Channel] https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd9Q-GzcRtJJ0KSX4jAdbzQ

Another day camp video! Just out exploring the woods looking for good spots for overnights. I brought with me the ultimate survival technologies tube tarp to set up and see how it looks as well. 
No fire this time, but after posting this video I am off to do a solo overnight as the ban has been lifted since this video! Look out for that one next week.


Zed Outdoors: https://www.youtube.com/user/ZedOutdoors

Scrambled O: https://www.youtube.com/user/ScrambledO

Cheers Dave

Survival. Everyone has watched those shows on TV and have thought about what it would be like to survive in the woods. I like to take it one step further and have embarked on several solo survival adventures. Alone on Vancouver Island, I test my survival skills built upon a knowledge base of bushcraft and camping, so call it bushcraft survival. Bringing limited gear and creating different survival scenerios each time, I go out to see what I can do alone in the wild. I'm not an expert and I have lots I can improve on. Each time I do a survival challenge I try to better myself and allow myself to grow. Most of us learn best from doing and I like being thrown in the deep end. Here are my experiences. Learn from them, criticize them, imagine what you could do better because you never know when you might end up in a survival situation. 
Enjoy,
Dave from BC Bushcraft

In this bushcraft video, I show a variety of skills and simple techniques for some of the common bushcraft chores. Also, I do some exploring and plant ID, and cook up some eggs, bannock and coffee on the open flames. I hope you enjoy this bushcraft video, I plan to make a few more if people like them.

Cheers Dave

Another solo adventure! This time out I did a across between a solo survival video and a solo overnight bushcraft camp. I went out in mind to build a different type of survival shelter then I have previously done, while also bringing along some gear and food. A minimal bushcraft trip with solo survival elements incorporated into it, this video kind of finds the grey area between both activities. I hope everyone finds this one an enjoyable watch.
Take Care,
Dave
